glsa.title: KDE start_kdeinit: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in start_kdeinit could possibly allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

background.p: KDE is a feature-rich graphical desktop environment for Linux and Unix-like operating systems. start_kdeinit is a wrapper for kdeinit.

description.p: Vulnerabilities have been reported in the processing of user-controlled data by start_kdeinit, which is setuid root by default.

impact.p: A local attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with root privileges, cause a Denial of Service or send Unix signals to other processes, when start_kdeinit is setuid root.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
